meanings.definition: Stay where one is or delay action until a particular time or event.
meanings.sent1: I am waiting for the bus to arrive.
meanings.sent2: She is waiting patiently for her turn.
meanings.sent3: The cat is waiting for the mouse to come out of its hole.
meanings.sent4: The flowers are waiting for the rain to quench their thirst.
meanings.sent5: The students are waiting eagerly for the bell to ring.

meanings.definition: The action of staying where one is or delaying action until a particular time or event.
meanings.sent1: The waiting in line at the amusement park was long.
meanings.sent2: There was a sense of anticipation in the waiting room.
meanings.sent3: The waiting for the cake to bake seemed endless.
meanings.sent4: The waiting for the results of the test was nerve-wracking.
meanings.sent5: The waiting for the train was filled with excitement.
